summary: Robert K. Tanenbaum is identified as a staff member of the House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). The documents primarily relate to HSCA staff payroll records and the Assassination Records Review Board's (ARRB) decisions regarding the release of these records. One document specifically includes payroll records and related correspondence regarding Tanenbaum's employment with the HSCA, including authorizations, leave records, and a resume. The ARRB postponed the release of Social Security numbers in these records to protect personal privacy. While the documents confirm Tanenbaum's employment with the HSCA, they do not provide specific details about his role or contributions to the committee's investigation into the JFK assassination.
significance: Robert K. Tanenbaum's significance lies in his employment with the House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA), which investigated the JFK assassination. The documents indicate his presence on the HSCA staff, but do not detail his specific role or contributions to the investigation.
